properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 9:53AM CST until January 14 at 8:15AM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in
Illinois...

Skillet Fork River at Wayne City

.Recent heavy rainfall over the Skillet Fork River basin has caused river
levels to rise. Moderate flooding is occurring at Wayne City, and major
flooding is forecast to develop today. A crest around 20.2 feet is forecast
by this evening.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Skillet Fork River at Wayne City.
* until Tuesday morning.
* At  9:00 AM Sunday the stage was 19.6 feet.
* Flood Stage is 15.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is occurring and Major flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near 20.2 feet by this
evening. The river will fall below flood stage early Tuesday
morning.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
